A robust CCVA should account for all three elements, thereby facilitating identification of the most vulnerable species and the characteristics that determine their vulnerability
8, 10 . However, recent reviews indicate that CCVAs are commonly based on sensitivity and exposure
9, 39 . It has been suggested that assessments that fail to account for any of the three elements may be incomplete and produce biased outcomes, thereby rendering them less reliable for guiding conservation decisions
4, 8, 15 .
